text:
ðŸ‡±ðŸ‡¹ Lithuania: Largest Ever Viewing Audience For Eurovision Grand Final
Almost 1 million people watched the Grand Final of Eurovision 2021 in Lithuania, becoming their highest viewing audience to date.
Lithuania recorded its largest-ever audience for a Eurovision Grand Final on Saturday evening. The Grand Final of the Eurovision Song Contest 2021 was watched by a total of almost 1 million people across LRT Television and their streaming platform, where they watched their participants The Roop take 8th place, their second-highest placement. 897,600 people watched the contest on LRT with a further 100,000 watching online.
The first semifinal in which The Roop participated in, was watched by approximately 812,700 people on LRT Television and more than 60,0000 on their online viewing platform LRT.lt. The second semifinal was viewed by almost 594,500 people on LRT Television.

Lithuania in the Eurovision Song Contest Lithuania debuted in the Eurovision Song Contest in 1994, however on their debut they finished in last place with nul points. Lithuaniaâ€™s best result came in 2006 when LT United performed â€œWe Are The Winnersâ€?; they finished 6th in the final with a total of 162 points. Lithuaniaâ€™s only other top 10 finish came in 2016 when Donny Montell performed â€œIâ€™ve Been Waiting For This Nightâ€? in Stockholm, he received 12 points from the public in Ireland, Norway & United Kingdom.
